comments:
I'm trying to create a new web repository (mylar 0.9.0):

1) select azureus
2) edit the parameters
3) overwrite name (change azureus to videodb)
4) click Finish-> exception

5) validate settings-> nothing happens

I can't reproduce this. Can you please check if you used Web connector from the sandbox before installing Mylar 0.9? If so, please uninstall old sandbox feature or install new version that does not include web connector.

From the stack trace, it seems like you have changed url of already saved repository for which you had some queries created, but I can't reproduce this either.

Also, SourceForge site repository is rather interesting. Its url is not specific to the projects and label in the template should just say sourceforge.net, then maybe have some info (even in dummy property) that used group_id is for Azureus project... Most of the other repository templates from web-connector have project-specific part in the urls.

What I had tried to do was to modify an existing web repository that still used the old 0.7 mechanism. I've tried to select Azureus as template then and change the id parameters.
From the repository properties dialog it is not clear what is an existing repository (as the old one) and what is a template (as Azureus).
After recreating the videoDB repository from scratch, this works as expected- Validation is still broken though.

Mylar is using server URL as repository ID. So, if you change that url Mylar is trying to rename some related artifacts and since web repository data had changed quite a lot, it fail. So, web connector repositories need to be recreated because of that. As of template, it is just a thing that fills all the fields for you, so if you do that on existing repository it may change server url and hence trigger that renaming.

Mik, Rob, I believe we can close this issue as "worksome". Basically incompatibility with sandbox version of web connector.

Yup.  That's what the sandbox is for, and in general we won't require components to migrate the saved data when they are moved out of the sandbox.  But we should have been more clear on this when announcing 0.9 and the dev builds before it.  For components not in the sandbox we do promise to migrate the data.
